events.name: Join us for Google I/O Livestream
events.description: Come meetup with us to watch the livestream of the Google I/O 2015 Keynote and stay for some food, fun and prizes. If you have a startup you could win BIG. More about that later.
events.how_to_find_us: Second floor of the Sykes Building suite 200 in downtown Tampa

events.name: GDG Devfest and Women Tech Makers 2015
events.description:
Devfest 2015 is just around the corner so save the date and join us for some really cool Android Marshmallow sessions as well as Startup Weekend Bootcamp for developers and some really awesome Women Tech Makers and others speakers and Code Labs.

I'll be updating this page with specific breakout sessions as we schedule them.

As always the is no charge and plenty of swag, food and beverage.

A big thanks to all of our sponsors.
events.how_to_find_us: Here is a map for parking. http://www.tampabaywave.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Parking-Map-4.png

events.name: Women Tech Makers Devfest 2015
events.description:
About WTM

Women Techmakers is Google's global program and brand for women in technology. Kicked off in 2012 by then VP of Google[x] Megan Smith, Women Techmakers is now led by Women in Technology Advocate Natalie Villalobos and a global team of Googlers who are passionate about empowering women in technology through increased visibility, community, and resources. Each of our summits and meetups will be catered to local communities of women in technology. Summits and meetups around the world may feature hands-on coding workshops, inspiring speakers, and networking opportunities.

Devfest 2015 is just around the corner so save the date and join us for some really cool Android Marshmallow sessions as well as Startup Weekend Bootcamp for developers and some really awesome Women Tech Makers and others speakers and Code Labs.

I'll be updating this page with specific breakout sessions as we schedule them. As always the is no charge and plenty of swag, food and beverage.

A big thanks to all of our sponsors.
events.how_to_find_us: Here is a map for parking. http://www.tampabaywave.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Parking-Map-4.png

events.name: FREE Android Study Jams Sponsored by Google and Udacity
events.description:
What are Study Jams: 
Study Jams are community-organized study groups around Google online developer courses. The goal is to support as many students as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community. We will be working together in the Android class for beginners from Udacity with the help of some experienced developers.

The Study Jams for Android for Beginners is best suited for: 
   • Those new to programming 
   • Those with existing programming experience who have never developed for Android.

What students get: 
   • Personal tutoring on the course material
   • Community setting to support course learning
   • Swag pack
   • Google-provided Study Jams certificate to students who complete the course, submit a final project, and attend the Study Jams sessions.
   • Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion
   • Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality.

Important, we will be meeting two days, March 12th and 19th at the Tampa Bay WaVE location. Onsite we will go through the class material with Android Experts and answer questions, and you're expected to do some extra exercises at home. Creativity and exploration is encouraged.

Links: 
• More information at http://developerstudyjams.com/
• Join at https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams
•  Community support at https://goo.gl/UaUA8M﻿

events.name: Office Hours for the Android Study Jams
events.description:
This meetup will be an office hours session to help anyone that has questions or is having difficulties with the final project for the Android Study Jams.

To attend the session, RSVP as you would a normal meetup, then send Scott a private-message with your Hangouts ID at least one day before the meetup. You can do that by clicking on his name or avatar and then clicking on "Message". Do not post your ID as a public comment or you'll probably get bombarded with off-shore spam.

If nobody RSVPs by the morning of the meetup or nobody joins the hangouts session within 5 minutes of its start-time, that night's meetup will be canceled.

events.name: Android Study Jam Part I (Pasco)- Sponsored by Google and Udacity
events.description:
Note that this meetup is the first in a 2-part event; the second part will be held the next Saturday at the same time and place.

We are co-sponsoring this event with the Tampa Bay Android Developer Group

What are Study Jams:

Study Jams are community-organized study groups around Google online developer courses. The goal is to support as many students as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community. We will be working together in the Android class for beginners from Udacity with the help of some experienced developers.

The Study Jams for Android for Beginners is best suited for:
   • Those new to programming
   • Those with existing programming experience who have never developed for Android.

What students get:
   • Personal tutoring on the course material
   • Community setting to support course learning
   • Swag pack
   • Google-provided Study Jams certificate to students who complete the course, submit a final project, and attend the Study Jams sessions.
   • Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion

IMPORTANT INFORMATION: 

We will be meeting two days, April 23 and 30th at SMARTstart Business Incubator
6345 Grand Blvd, New Port Richey, FL. Please ensure that you are registered for the course via the links below. Also, please review all of lesson 1 prior to the first session. We will cover this session and review questions and the practice set. We want to ensure that there is enough time for everyone to complete all three lessons and their final project. 

Onsite we will go through the class material with Android Experts and answer questions and help you understand core concepts and principles in developing for Android. You will be expected to do some extra exercises at home. Creativity and exploration is encouraged.

Links:

• More information at http://developerstudyjams.com/
• Join at https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams
• Community support at https://goo.gl/UaUA8M﻿
events.how_to_find_us: Free parking on the south side of building.

events.name: How Butter Knife can simplify your Android code
events.description:
Butter Knife is an Android library that allows for field and method binding for Android views. In this GDG SunCoast meet up we're going to take a look at how we can start to use Butter Knife to simplify our Android code.﻿

Here's the link to the meet up. We're using a different type of Hangout this time around. This will allow us to record the session for later use.

events.how_to_find_us: Pull around the back and enter the main door. Look for a sign.

events.name: Google I/O Extended & DevFest
events.description:
In cooperation with the Tampa Bay Android Developers Group, please join us as we recap some of the announcements from this past I/O. We will also be offering break out sessions with code labs so that you can get hands on experience with some of the new tools and technology that's in the upcoming Android and Android Studio releases.

The agenda for the event will be:

   10:30 -- Introductions
   10:40 -- Recap of this year's Google I/O Keynote
   11:20 -- Breakout Session 1
   12:15 -- Breakout Session 2
    1:00 -- Lunch, provided
    1:30 -- Floating Codelabs

Four of the following will be the topics for the two breakout sessions. Please send a message to Scott (via meetup or gdg25june @ centripetalfusion.com) with your top-4 preferences by June 22nd.

  • Building Android TV Apps
  • Using the new Constraint Layout
  • New Features of the Dev-tools
  • Introduction to Firebase
  • Nearby Messages and Connections
  • Using the the Transitions API

For the codelabs, please bring a development laptop. At least two seasoned Android developers will float among the participants and help them with any issues encountered working through a codelab of their choice from the Google Codelabs.

events.name: GDG Sun Coast Monthly - Android Pay in your app
events.description:
Get Android Pay in your app to make it easier for your users to pay you faster and easier.﻿ This will be a virtual meeting using Hangouts on Air.

https://plus.google.com/events/c1rpc403122njatno7f4jnoofcg

events.name: DevFest Florida 2016
events.description:
DevFest Florida is the biggest Google tech conference in Florida this year. It is all about Android and the Web, straight from the experts.

*** NOTICE ***
This is a ticketed event. Head over to http://devfestflorida.eventbrite.com for tickets.
*** ***

DevFest Florida 2016 is going to take place on November 5th, 2016 at the Sheraton Lake Buena Vista in Orlando. DevFest Florida is going to be focused on Android & Web technologies! It will also offer a networking mixer event for attendees to meet the speakers and to provide great networking opportunities for all professionals and students. It will be a great way to get to know your Google tech neighbors.

In most parts of the country, November weather is lousy. Before the holidays are upon us, pack a bag and join us for some fantastic weather and even better technical content! While you're here enjoy some great food, drink, and time on the beach. Not a lot of tech conferences can offer you all of that.

Organized by three Google Developer Group (GDG) chapters: Sun Coast, Central Florida, and Space Coast. GDGs are open communities, run by volunteers passionate about Google technology, and look to share their experiences and knowledge with others.

This is a non-profit event. All proceeds from ticket sales will be used for event costs like the venue, audio/visual, food, beverages, swag, etc.

events.name: Firebase Study Group for Android and iOS Developers
events.description:
Do you miss Parse.com? Do you really not like backend development? Wouldn't it be cool if you could just focus on your mobile app and not worry so much about the backend?

Join us and learn how to leverage some of the awesome features of Firebase, like their real time database, authenticating into your app and push messaging. We'll be covering the Firebase in a Weekend courses offered by Udacity that are geared to Android AND iOS developers. This session will allow us to cover some of the basics during this meetup. If you can't finish the whole course during the meetup we'll be around online to help you should you have any questions.

One (1) lucky attendee will be receiving an annual license to a JetBrains Toolbox product of your choice!

As always with our Saturday sessions, lunch will be served to those in attendance.

Please help spread the word about the event!
events.how_to_find_us: Follow us on twitter @gdgsuncoast or via our Google+ page https://plus.google.com/+ScgdgOrg

events.name: Test Driven Android Development/App Indexing: Apps in search results/Socializing
events.description:
This meetup's agenda:
* 5 minutes for introductions
* 45 minutes for talk 1 -- Test Driven Android Development
* 30 minutes for talk 2 -- App Indexing: Apps in search results
* Remaining time for open discussion (i.e. socializing)

If anyone is interested, we can also adjourn to one of the nearby eating and/or drinking places for extra socializing.

The first talk will involve doing some Android development via a TDD approach. We'll be looking into how easy it is to use the Espresso and Mockito tools from within Android Studio.

In the the second talk, Mike Traverso will present how to use Firebase App Indexing to get your Android app's data searchable by Google and show up in search results.

events.name: Lightning Round Talks
events.description:
For this meetup, we'll be doing another set of Lightning Round talks! 

This will be a collection of 1-15 minute mini-talks by different members. If you'd like to present, please message us soon to reserve your slot.

The talks do not have be Android related. They can be about anything that would be of general interest to someone involved in Android development. In fact, there's only one real rule for the mini-talks -- they're limited to 15 minutes, including questions! 

Giving a lightning talk is great because you get to

• Show off your skill to the community. You're awesome why not show off a little?

• Share a recent app, API, SDK, hardware, language or feature that you've just discovered with folks that are eager to enjoy it too!

• Give back to the community.

• Learn something new and practice your public speaking!

Some of the talks so far include: 
   • Using Butterknife --Gaby Quiles 
   • Using Android Auto in the Marine Industry -- David Rothwell 
   • Firebase Cloud Functions: Making your Firebase Func-y -- Mike
   • Messaging Techniques -- Randy Dalrymple 
   • Exploring the Compiled Android App -- Connor Tumbleson 
   • Searching History with Grep -- Harvey Chapman 
   • Genymotion Overview -- Dave Cagle 
   • Something about Marketing or Branding -- Trevor 

While we normally limit recruitment to before or after the actual meetup talks, we'll allow one scheduled recruiting mini-talk during this meetup. So if you're a recruiter stop sending out LinkedIn requests and offer to buy us snacks and we'll let you pitch yourself & your firm.

** You don't have to give a lightning talk to attend but it's definitely encouraged! **
events.how_to_find_us: Ride the elevator up to the third floor classrooms; our room is on the near right.

events.name: Android & Augmented Reality
events.description:
This meetup is going to be covering computer vision & Android. Joey deVilla is coming to talk to us about Android and Computer Vision. Recently Joey wrote an Android app that uses the device’s cameras to recognize facial features and draws Snapchat-like features on people’s faces. 

If you're interested in computer vision, Android or how to detect objects in the camera's data stream and layer additional assets on top of them (like snapchat filters) into your app you should definitely plan on attending this one! Joey deVilla is a great developer that lives in the Tampa area and he's worked at some big time companies. He runs a blog called Global Nerdy and always carries an accordion. He's a great speaker and I strongly encourage you to check out his blog, follow him on social media and definitely come to this meetup.

We've taken care of any issues that you may have had in the past about getting upstairs. So please join us for what is sure to be a very fun & informative time.
events.how_to_find_us: Ride the elevator up to the 3rd floor. The meeting room is on the far left. On-street parking is free north of Kennedy Blvd.

events.name: Android Wear: Developing your own custom watch faces
events.description:
This meetup's agenda: 
 * 10 minutes for introductions and announcements
 * 45+ minutes for talk 1 -- Android Wear: Your Own Faces! 
 * 30 minutes for talk 2 -- Android Studio Tips and Tricks Round-table discussion.

If anyone is interested, we can also adjourn to one of the nearby eating and/or drinking places for extra socializing. 

In the the first talk, we'll talk we'll look at what's involved in creating your own watch faces for Android Wear. Be prepared to design & develop as more Android Wear 2.0 watches debut this year.

The second talk will be a round-table discussion of everyone's favorite tips and tricks when using the Android Studio IDE. Everyone that's used Android Studio should bring a list of their favorites.
events.how_to_find_us: Ride the elevator up to the third floor classrooms; our room is on the near right.

events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Tampa & St. Pete
events.description:
Google's I/O event is their annual developer event. If you can't make it to Mountain View but want to enjoy all the news, code labs and excitement this event is for you! 

We’ll be covering all the big announcements and news from Google I/O, as well as some of the new SDKs, APIs and other tech. We’ll have experienced developers on hand to help you through the code labs from I/O as well.

Lunch will be served and we’ll have some cool swag & prizes to give out. 

Tell your co-workers and friends! This is going to be a great time and full of details about all the new stuff.

Grab your GDG Sun Coast I/O 2017 Extended shirts at https://teespring.com/gdg-suncoast-io-extended. 50% of the profits of these shirts will go to St. Jude Children's Hospital. The other half will go to supporting the group efforts. This means you'll help cover the cost of venues, food & swag. Help support the group and a great cause and look cool while doing it. Unlike past years there are ladies sizes available instead of the default unisex sizes.

events.name: Android & ConstraintLayout
events.description:
For this meetup, Scott will present a preview of a talk he will be giving at this summer's AnDevCon in DC:

Build a Faster UI with Constraint Layout

ConstraintLayout, which was first introduced as an alpha-level feature at last year's I/O has now matured into the go-to tool for large and complex layouts. While similar to RelativeLayout, using it is much more flexible, easy, and intuitive. The resulting layouts will be flatter and perform better at run time. Even though it's the newest layout, it's compatible for use in SDK versions as far back as Android 2.3 Gingerbread (API 9).

In this session, you will learn how to:

• enable constraint layouts in your project
• use the new Layout Editor to work with constraint layouts
•convert existing layouts to constraint layout
• add new constraint layouts
• determine and add appropriate constraints
• configure constraint properties
• avoid some common pitfalls

As usual, we will adjourn afterwards to one of the nearby eating and/or drinking places for extra socializing.

events.name: Intro to Machine Learning (AI) w/ TensorFlow
events.description:
For this meetup, we'll be diving into TensorFlow! If you've been hearing about AI, or machine learning, lately and thought to yourself 'here comes Skynet!' and then thought 'cool! I want to learn more about that!" then this is the meetup for you.

TensorFlow is an open source library for numerical computation, specializing in machine learning applications. At I/O Extended we took a look at how TensorFlow can be used in an Android app to do some cool image processing. In this session we'll dive deeper and see how to install & setup TensorFlow, look at a neural network and then write code to have it do some processing for us.

As usual, we will adjourn afterwards to one of the nearby eating and/or drinking places for extra socializing.

events.name: Data Persistence in Android with Room & How to be a an Android Expert
events.description:
In Google I/O we learned about Room and how great it is for persisting data without having to write all that tedious boilerplate code we would if we were just using a SQLite database on its own. 

We'll also check out Chiu-Ki Chan speaking about How to Become an Android Expert. Chiu-Ki is a Google Developer Expert in Android. This talk is all about what steps we can take in our every day dealings with Android. If you're interested in upping your Android developer game there are TONS of tips to listen to here.
events.how_to_find_us: Facing 260 1st Ave South, to the right of the steps there is an elevator. Take that up to the 3rd floor and look for the GDG Sun Coast banner

events.name: Google Play: Tools, App Submit, Beta Users & Hacking Apps w/ Google Apps Scripts
events.description:
At this meetup Lee Woods of CareSync will be showing us all the new tools in the Google Play Console, walking through the App Submission process, setting up Beta Users and more.

Then we'll have Ryan Hatter discuss a variety of features of Google Apps Scripts walking us through a sample project. Google Apps Script is a JavaScript cloud scripting language that provides easy ways to automate tasks across Google products and third party services and build web applications.

This session should be a LOT of fun and CareSync has assured me that the AC will be turned on to COLD! :)
events.how_to_find_us: We will have someone downstairs until 7:15pm. If you know you are going to be late please tell us prior to the event so we can tell you how to get in touch with us. We'll start the talks promptly at 7:20pm

events.name: Using Kotlin to develop for Android with an intro to Mobile Site Certification
events.description:
Kotlin is the latest and greatest way of developing your Android apps. We'll introduce you to some of the basics and then have a live coding session where we will build a simple app. We'll also get into how to integrate Kotlin and Java in the same project and some of the differences between the languages.

Finally, coming soon we will have a new Study Jam. Our first Study Jams in 2016 were a big hit and helped local developers get comfortable developing for the Android platform. This one will be aimed at the web developers, and folks interested in becoming web developers as we cover Mobile Site Certification. Part of this session will introduce you to what Progressive Web Apps (PWA), Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP), tooling and speed for mobile

events.name: DevFest Florida 2017
events.description:
We are completely SOLD OUT. There will be no tickets sold at the door. 

We are looking forward to seeing those of you with tickets on Saturday. Everyone else we'll hopefully see you at the holiday party or at our January meetup!

events.name: Meet Tampa's Tech Stars At Our Holiday Party!
events.description:
You could WIN one of 3 Google Daydream Viewers or one of several $25 Gift certificates at this FREE event!
Malwarebytes has been kind enough to Host our event at their awesome location and supply Food and Drink. That includes beer and wine! Come join us for fun, food, drinks and door prizes. Have a good time socializing with other techies.
Please share this event with your friends. Use the Hashtag #gdgholiday on Facebook or Twitter to enter yourself for a special prize. (Must be present to win.)
events.how_to_find_us: Free Parking. Just look for the Malwarebytes sign.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
• What we'll do
Details
• What we'll do
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give your community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

Topics
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.

• What to bring
Laptop, power cord.

• Important to know

events.name: Mobile Site Certification Study Jam
events.description:
GDG Suncoast is organizing a study jam on mobile site certification. This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Requirements

You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. You can find more details on the course here. It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group.

Why do it?

There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement.

events.name: Google Assistant - Build Actions for Your Community
events.description:
• What we'll do
Details
• What we'll do
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant. “Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series. Come and learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant.

Agenda
10:00 am Welcome
10:10 am Building Conversational Experiences
10:40 am Conversational Design
11:10 am Coffee Break/Idea Exchange
11:25 am Codelab: Build a conversational App
12:30 pm Lunch - provided by GDG Suncoast & WTM Tampa
1:00 pm Creating your own Actions for the Google Assistant
3:00 pm Demo your Actions

• What to bring
laptop

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: We will be on the 2nd floor and our primary entrance is through the black gate on the east side patio. Unless otherwise noted, parking will be available in the east parking lot directly adjacent to our building. I

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Suncoast and WTM Tampa Bay for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

If you have any problems installing flutter do not hesitate to send a message to the organizers. Alternatively we will help you get set up at the meetup.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam - Part 2
events.description:
This is part 2 of our Flutter Study Jam. If you did not attend the first part - No Worries! You can easily catch up by working through the Udacity course up to Lesson 1 Part 13.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Suncoast and WTM Tampa Bay for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

If you have any problems installing flutter do not hesitate to send a message to the organizers. Alternatively we will help you get set up at the meetup.

events.name: Migrating to the Google Cloud Platform - How to Get Started
events.description:
Tampa and Orlando Google Cloud Computing Events is hosting an event Migrating to the Google Cloud Platform - How to Get Started

https://www.meetup.com/Tampa-and-Orlando-Google-Cloud-Computing-Events/events/253139558/

The openness and flexibility of Google Cloud empowers you to build and evolve your technology on your terms. Hybrid-friendly by design, Google Cloud can run infrastructure on-premises, while you leverage the security and scalability of the cloud. Plan, build, and manage reliable applications across on-premises data centers, private-hosted servers, or multi-cloud environments. Save time and money when you shift infrastructure and apps from on-premises virtual machines to VMs hosted in the cloud.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam - Part 3
events.description:
This is part 3 of our Flutter Study Jam. If you did not attend the first part - No Worries! You can easily catch up by working through the Udacity course and completing Lesson 1. We will work through Lesson 2.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Suncoast and WTM Tampa Bay for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

If you have any problems installing flutter do not hesitate to send a message to the organizers. Alternatively we will help you get set up at the meetup.

events.name: Bill Bensing will share his approach for a rich snippets SEO strategy
events.description:
Are you aware of rich snippets? Do you know the first principles behind rich snippets? The SEO landscape is forever changing, although rooted in fundamental principles. Bill Bensing’s research into these first principles exposed a set of practices and technology which allow organizations to excel in SEO and provide great digital experiences, all while decreasing the amount of custom software written and increasing maintainability of a company's technology landscape.

Bill will share his approach for a rich snippets SEO strategy utilizing single page web application frameworks (SPA), progressive web app (PWA) technology, and Google’s own SEO tool Rendertron. He will talk you through a solution to render JSON-LD, and other metadata, dynamically for search engines which do not execute JavaScript as part of their indexing approach. This is all informed by the methods, techniques, and technology Google openly speaks about for their rich snippets.

You will have access to the source code Bill has implemented for his own products at the end of this session. This code allows you to build and host web applications on web-scale technology like Kubernetes.

This talk is as deep as it is broad. It is great for an engineer or developer tasked to solve similar problems. It’s perfect for the technical minded business leader who requires deeper understanding for guiding their organizations tactics to better SEO outcomes. We look forward to seeing you here!

events.name: Flutter Live 2018 Viewing Party
events.description:
Join us for Flutter Live (https://developers.google.com/events/flutter-live/) on December 5th to experience the latest from Flutter, Google’s free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase. Presented from the Science Museum in London, we are playing the recorded announcement. Then we will complete a codelab together.
Bring your laptop with Android Studio and Flutter SDK installed.
Dinner and drinks will be provided along with some Flutter swag.

events.name: DevFest Florida
events.description:
GET YOUR TICKET TODAY: devfestflorida-orlando.eventbrite.com

DevFest Florida is the most magical developer conference in Florida. BUT it's also so much more! It is all about Mobile, Web, Cloud, AI, AR/VR, IoT and other modern technologies!

The idea behind DevFest Florida is to bring top talent to Florida, support local developers with an inclusive environment for learning new technology, and to help developers, designers create relationships with each other & organizations

DevFest Florida is made in collaboration with Google Developer Group (GDG) Central Florida, Tampa Bay, Space Coast and our amazing sponsors.

We are always looking for opportunities to better connect your brand and our thriving tech community. If you'd like to sponsor this or any other event please reach out to us via [masked]

Find the latest information about speakers, agenda, and other exciting news at devfestflorida.org

What to expect?
20+ speakers from top tech companies and development experts across industries and tool stacks

Learn more about Angular, Flutter, Go, Android, App Scripts, UX, Machine Learning, Firebase, Cloud, Web, and other technologies.

Multiple Tracks on Mobile, Web and "New Hotness" (The latest and greatest of machine learning, IoT, Google Actions, and more) technology

Local talent as well as other experts from around the world speaking and sharing their expertise on multiple technologies

Meet other developers, designers, testers, tech entrepreneurs and enthusiasts

A dedicated audience of 400+ technology professionals

Magical Venue steps away from the Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World

Tickets cover breakfast, lunch and coffee for that day

Awesome Swag & Prizes

After hours fireworks celebration (tickets required)

Magical Moments

Impactful event striving to promote diversity and inclusion

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Security
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console with a focus on Security.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you would like to complete.

Security is an uncompromising feature of Google Cloud Platform services, and GCP has developed specific tools for ensuring safety and identity across your projects. In this fundamental-level quest, you will get hands-on practice with GCP’s Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, which is the go-to for managing user and virtual machine accounts. You will get experience with network security by provisioning VPCs and VPNs, and learn what tools are available for security threat and data loss protections.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - IoT
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console with a focus on IoT in the Google Cloud.

The hands-on lab will cover the following topics:

1. Internet of Things: Qwik Start
2. A Tour of Cloud IoT Core
3. Streaming IoT Data to Google Cloud Storage
Bonus:
Google Assistant: Qwik Start - Templates
Deploy an eligible action on Google Assistant and earn $200 monthly Google Cloud credit and an Assistant t-shirt.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you would like to complete.
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Suncoast
events.description:
Kotlin/Everywhere Suncoast

Come learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multi-platform development.

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness.

Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Don't forget your charger!

AGENDA
Networking & Refreshments
Demo:
Kotlin native running on Raspberry Pi
Codelab:
Extend an Android frontend with a Kotlin backend running on App Engine
Raffle

events.name: Flutter Study Jam * Building a CRUD app for iOS, Android w/Flutter & Firestore
events.description:
Need a quick, cross-platform app for a business idea? This talk is for you! Flutter is Google's open source UI toolkit that empowers you to create apps for iOS, Android, and the Web with one codebase! Firebase is Google's cloud computing platform. The combination of the two is powerful, allowing us to rapidly create real-world, robust apps. In this session we'll create an iOS and Android app that reads and writes from Firestore live!

This Talk is by Rap Payne Author and Flutter expert.
Bio:
Rap is a developer, trainer, and entrepreneur (not necessarily in that order) who recently wrote a book on Flutter development (http://bit.ly/flutter_book) for Apress. He’s well-known as an active member in the worldwide Flutter community, having organized some hackathons and won others. Rap lives in Dallas, Texas with his wife Becky and five kids.

events.name: Networking Event @ JP Morgan Chase
events.description:
WOMEN IN TECH event hosted by JP Morgan Chase

Are you a highly skilled, experienced Software Engineer or Technologist looking for your next career move? If so, please consider applying for our upcoming networking reception:

JPMorgan Chase Women In Technology US Networking Reception – A Discussion On Empowerment w/Global CIO Lori Beer via Tele-Presence
Wednesday, January 22nd, 6-8:30pm

Pre-Registration is required as seating is limited and walk in’s will not be permitted to enter through security.

We’re excited to have you attend this exclusive US networking event featuring JPMorgan Chase's Global CIO, Lori Beer as the key-note speaker who will be leading a Discussion on Empowerment. This event is being hosted at 7 of our US Tech Center Locations: Chicago, IL, Columbus, OH, Dallas, TX, Houston, TX, Tampa, FL, Wilmington, DE, New York City, NY.

Light food and refreshments will be provided.

Schedule of Events
5:30 - 6:00 pm - Registration
6:00 - 6:55 pm – Networking and Welcome
7:00 - 7:45 pm – US Fireside Chat via Telepresence w/Lori Beer – A Discussion on Empowerment with Q&A
7:45 - 8:30 pm - Closing Remarks/ Networking / Meet JPMorgan Chase Technology Hiring Managers

Resumes are welcomed and encouraged as both recruiting and hiring managers will be onsite to share our exciting opportunities with you.

Click Here to Apply:

https://jpmchase.taleo.net/careersection/010/jobdetail.ftl?job=190107438&lang=en&sns_id=mailto#.XfFWzljKMEQ.mailto

Deadline: Wednesday, January 15th, 2020

Joining the Technology Team at JPMorgan Chase & Co. isn’t just about what you’ll be doing today, it’s about the impact your ideas will have tomorrow. At this event you will have the opportunity to hear how our technology teams are making an impact by creating innovative technology solutions that touch the lives of millions of customers and clients around the world.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value innovation and collaboration. As part of a fast-paced, agile team, you'll use the latest development methodologies and technologies to create solutions for real business needs. And we'll encourage you to move among our businesses, improving your knowledge and tackling challenges daily.

Are you ready to build your future?

We look forward to connecting with you soon.

Location provided after registration on their website.

events.name: Animation with MotionLayout
events.description:
Hosted by Tampa Bays Android Developers Guild

https://www.meetup.com/Tampa-Bay-Android-Developers-Group/events/268011986/

For February's meetup, we will be learning about animation.

This meetup's agenda:

● 10 minutes for introductions, announcements, a bit of socializing, and perhaps try out some more tasty homemade treats.

● 5 minutes for a discussion of the latest Android news.

● 100 minutes for a walk-through of the Google Codelab, "Animation with MotionLayout". In this codelab, we'll learn about a very new Android development feature that allows us to animate multiple views at the same time using a declarative XML. We'll also demo the new Motion Editor feature of Android Studio 4.0 that allows us to define the MotionLayout elements using a graphical design tool.

While this codelab is part of the "Advanced Android in Kotlin" course, don't worry if you're still new to Kotlin; the code that we'll be implementing will be pretty Java-like. (If you'd like to work along on your own laptop, it would be helpful to have Android Studio 4.0 installed and to download and build the sample app at https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/motion-layout)

● Wrap up -- Scott will again ask anyone has something they'd like to present and we'll decide on which nearby eatery to visit for some extra socializing.

* Image from "Advanced Android in Kotlin 03.2: Animation with MotionLayout" Google Codelab at

upcoming.name: Signed, Sealed, Delivered: Securely uploading and presenting multimedia on GCS
upcoming.description:
Come and join ReactJS Tampa Bay

The “why”: Handling file uploads at high scale can become a resource intensive PITA! In this session we will demonstrate how to create Signed URLs with Cloud Functions and use the browser to directly upload large files to Google Cloud Storage.

AGENDA

SCHEDULE

6:30: Pizzas and beverages served, General Networking
7:00-8:00: Presentation

LINEUP
Signed, Sealed, Delivered: Securely uploading and presenting multimedia on GCS

John Hampton

LOGISTICS

We will be hosting @ Exzeo USA

About the Presenter

John is a founding member of the ReactJS Tampa Bay Meetup and currently works as an Engineering Manager at GitLab. He previously worked at AgileThought and has been in the Software Industry for ~17 years. He enjoys all technology, and favors Go, Node, and Python.
